intro: Galium orizabense subsp. orizabense, commonly known as the Mexican bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to central Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically borne in terminal spikes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
